title: tour: [variable name is confusing, make clearer]
body:
Context: http://www.tour.golang.org/flowcontrol/3

For new people trying to learn Go, using a variable called "sum" is confusing.  
sum looks like an operator.

Suggest changing the name of the variable to say, "total"

(refers to this)

func main() {
	sum := 1
	for sum < 1000 {
		sum += sum
	}
	fmt.Println(sum)
